description: Reserved Matters Application (Appearance, Scale and Landscaping) following approval of outline planning permission ref: PP/2013/3938 dated 17/07/2014 (as varied by minor material amendment applications ref: PP/2014/5491 dated 05/02/2015 and ref: 165410 dated 06/12/2016;  and pending the decision of the minor material amendment ref: 172789VAR to facilitate minor changes to building heights, floor uses and residential unit numbers ) for the redevelopment of the site (following demolition of existing buildings except for retained cinema facade) to provide multi-screen cinema of up to 3,114 sq m, including mezzanine levels, up to 3,358sqm mixed commercial floor space (Classes A1/A2/ A3/A4/ D2) at ground and part first floor level, gallery space (Class D1) and up to 209 residential units (Class C3) in buildings of between 6 and 9 storeys in height. Creation of public realm including outdoor performance space. Change of use of unit to the rear of No.49 New Broadway to bicycle store and change of use of unit to the rear of rear of No.55 New Broadway to management office suite. Alterations to and creation of new vehicular and pedestrian access routes. Associated servicing areas and disabled car parking spaces (Outline Planning Application for layout and access)

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

2.	Prior to commencement of above ground superstructure works for each phase of the development, details of the materials (including samples) to be used for the external surfaces of the relevant phase of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
The samples and details shall include:
1.	brickwork (including brick panels and mortar courses);
2.	cladding and colours;
3.	re-constituted stone;
4.	all window treatments (including sections and reveals);
5.	balcony structures and balustrading treatment (including sections);
6.	privacy screens;
7.	metal, cement and render facing and banding detail;
8.	ventilation and extraction louvres;
9.	shop fronts; and all other external materials to be used.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings and the development achieves a high quality appearance in accordance with policies 1.1(h) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

3.	Prior to commencement of the relevant phase of the development (comprising Building A/the retained cinema façade), details of the treatment of the elevation behind the columns on the retained cinema façade shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings and the development achieves a high quality appearance in accordance with policies 1.1(h) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies 7.6, 7.8 and 7.9 of the London Plan 2016 and policies 7C and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

4.	Prior to commencement of above ground superstructure works for each phase of the development, details of hard and soft landscaping including tree planting for the relevant phase of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The details as approved shall be laid out and planted within the first planting season following the commencement of the relevant phase of the development or such other period as may be agreed in writing with the local planning authority. Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season. This hard and soft landscaping shall be subject to a landscape management plan, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by local planning authority prior to the first occupation of the development. The landscaping shall thereafter be maintained and managed in accordance with the approved landscape management programme.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.5, 5.10, 7.4, 7.5, 7.8 & 7.21 of the London Plan 2016, polices 1.2 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 3.5, 5.10, 7.4, 7C & 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

5.	Prior to commencement of above ground superstructure works for each phase of the development, details of crime prevention measures to comply with the aims and objectives of Secured by Design for the relevant phase of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, which shall be completed prior to the first occupation of the relevant phase of the development hereby approved and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: In the interest of the safety of the future occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.3,7.4-7.6 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and policy 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.
6.	No part of the proposed balconies or terraces within the development shall be used as storage areas or areas for the hanging or drying of washing at any time.

Reason: To protect the appearance and character of the area, in accordance with policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document 2013.

7.	Prior to the construction of the relevant part of the development, detailed drawings at a scale of 1:50 of the windows, doors and shopfronts in respect of each part of the development hereby permitted, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to first use/occupation of the relevant part of each of the buildings.

Reason: To ensure that the details of the windows, doors and shop fronts are appropriate for the development, and safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013; and polices 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2016.

8.	Prior to the commencement of each phase of the development which includes public realm, details of the surface materials, play features, street furniture (seating and bins) external lighting and all other structures to be erected within the public realm; including their location and fixings, together with the details as to how the retained Walpole Theatre Arch will be incorporated into the scheme (within the relevant phase), shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to first use of the relevant part of the public realm within the development.

Reason: To ensure that the features, furniture and structures to be installed within the areas of public realm are appropriate for the development, and safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area, in accordance with policies 2.5, 6.1, 5.10, 7.4, 7B, and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013; and polices 7.4, 7.5, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2016.
